EmailTemplate.subject: Improve your employment prospects
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
The Challenge Network / Society
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Hello from The Challenge Society!
We have some fantastic taster sessions planned for you this Easter! They are a mix of opportunities which will provide you with amazing experiences, build your skills, boost your CV and allow you to meet organisations who invest in young people.
If you are interested in working with vulnerable children, preventing homelessness, volunteering abroad or getting experience at a renowned art gallery then have a taste and see if it's for you!
Midland Heart ~ Volunteer for one of the city's most exciting and leading homeless charities. 10th April 11am - 2.30pm. Contact tom.haigh@the-challenge.org
Raleigh International ~ Carry out amazing community projects overseas. 11th April 3 - 5pm. Contact becki.vesey@the-challenge.org
Dens Of Equality ~ Support play sessions for vulnerable children. 12th April 10am - 5pm. Contact emma.crump@the-challenge.org
Barber Institute ~ Volunteer in the nationally renowned art gallery. 12th April 1pm. Contact katy.massey@the-challenge.org
Spaces are limited so please reserve your space today!
For those of you who registered your interest at the Festival speed matching session then this is the follow up. You may have also spoken to us on the phone about getting active in your community and building your skills, if so, these are the opportunities we have found that match up to what most people said they wanted to do.
Also there are still some spaces left for the Sports day on 4th April. Meet friends, unwind and have fun. To register or find out more email kate.knight@the-challenge.org
